nodes.bodyText: @dakrone do you think we should aim to prevent this case when updating the policy?
No I don't think so, I think we should allow a user to remove searchable snapshots from the policy as well as adding other actions (post searchable snapshot for instance) that should run just fine.

@dakrone there are several setting we configure for a searchable snapshot. I wonder if we should be more strict here and check the index name is configured for this setting? I chose not to as that's an invariant that should be guaranteed by the searchable-snapshots module. Is there a better setting to use here?
What do you think?

Can you add the policy id to the log message, so something like
[forcemerge] action is configured for index [myindex] in policy [manage-things] which is mounted ...
same comment here about the policy id
since we're here, can we check for the presence of the index.frozen (FrozenEngine.INDEX_FROZEN) setting and skip the freeze step if the index is already frozen?
since we re-use this setting name a few times, can we extract it somewhere into a variable in case we need to change it in the future? perhaps somewhere in LifecycleSettings?
